post.summary: CollectRecords launches the collection of GA records from a period of time
DeleteView deletes a view
GetAvailableViews returns a collection of GA views that can be chosen from to set a View for querying GA
GetView returns the currently set GA view for a business
SetView sets a business's GA view for querying
DeleteProperty deletes a property
GetAvailableProperties gets all available properties from Google for user to connect
GetCampaignInfoForProperty returns available campaigns under a given property
GetProperty returns the currently set GA property for a business
LookupProperties lookup all the connected properties for a given business
SetPropertyMulti sets a business's GA property for querying
UpdateProperty updates connected campaigns for an existing connected property
CollectGA4Records launches the collection of GA4 records from a period of time
CollectRecords launches the collection of GA records from a period of time
GetCampaignInfoForView fetches a list of campaigns under a view
DeleteView deletes a view
GetAvailableViews gets all available views from Google for user to connect
GetView returns the currently set GA view for a business
LookupViews lookup all the connected views for a given business
SetView sets a business's GA view for querying
SetViewMulti sets multiple views for a business
UpdateView updates connected campaigns for an existing connected view

partnerId.title: The Partner ID of the account to collect records

businessId.title: The Business ID of the account to collect records

startDate.title: The date to start collecting records (inclusive)

endDate.title: the date to end collecting records (inclusive)

partnerId.title: Partner ID the view is associated with

businessId.title: The business ID the view is associated with (aka the account group ID)

googleanalyticsv1DeleteViewRequest.title: The request sent to flag a view as deleted

googleanalyticsv1DeleteViewResponse.title: The success/fail response when deleting a view

partnerId.title: Partner ID for the account making the request

businessId.title: The business ID for the account making the request (aka the account group ID)

cursor.title: An optional cursor to be provided when fetching additional pages of results beyond the first

googleanalyticsv1GetAvailableGAViewsRequ.title:
Request that will query Google for the views available to the GA account 
associated with the Partner ID and Business ID. 
This will only be called after a user has granted authorization to connect
Their GA account

views.title: GAView object to which this user has access

nextCursor.title: A cursor for the next page of results, will be empty if no subsequent pages

googleanalyticsv1GetAvailableGAViewsResp.title: List of views available to the connected Google Analytics account

partnerId.title: Partner ID the view is associated with

businessId.title: The business ID the view is associated with (aka the account group ID)

googleanalyticsv1GetViewRequest.title: Get the current view connected an an account

partnerId.title: Partner ID the view is associated with

businessId.title: The business ID the view is associated with (aka the account group ID)

gaAccountId.title: The Google Analytics account ID the stored view will be connected to

gaPropertyId.title: The Google Analytics property ID the stored view will be connected to

gaViewId.title: The Google Analytics view ID the stored view with be connected to

googleanalyticsv1SetViewRequest.title: The request sent to store a view to start querying data

googleanalyticsv1SetViewResponse.title: The success/fail response when setting a view

partnerId.title: Partner ID the view is associated with

businessId.title: The business ID the view is associated with (aka the account group ID)

googleUserId.title: The Google User ID associated with the view.  This is how we link the view to an Oauth Token

gaWebPropertyName.title: The Google Analytics Web Property Name

gaWebPropertyId.title: The Google Analytics Web Property ID

gaUserName.title: The Username associated with the Google Analytics account

created.title: The time the view was first created

updated.title: The last time a view was updated

isBroken.title: A flag to show whether or not the view is working properly

initialCollectionRunning.title: A flag to show whether or not the initial collection is still running

partnerId.title: The Partner ID of the account to collect records

businessId.title: The Business ID of the account to collect records

category.title: The category the view belongs to

startDate.title: The date to start collecting records (inclusive)

endDate.title: the date to end collecting records (inclusive)

businessId.title: The business ID the view is associated with (aka the account group ID)

category.title: The category the view belongs to

googleanalyticsv2DeleteViewResponse.title: The success/fail response when deleting a view

googleanalyticsv2GetAvailableGAViewsRequ.title:
Request that will query Google for the views available to the GA account
associated with the user's google ID
This will only be called after a user has granted authorization to connect
Their GA account

views.title: View object to which this user has access

v2Category.description:
- CATEGORY_INVALID: Invalid Category
 - CATEGORY_WEBSITE: Category indicating Website Pro/Express
 - CATEGORY_ADINTEL: Category indicating Ad-Intel
 - CATEGORY_ALL: Category indicating all categories (Website/AdIntel)
v2Category.title: Category defines the category (typically a product) that the View will be associated with

partnerId.title: Partner ID the property is associated with

businessId.title: The business ID the property is associated with (aka the account group ID)

category.title: The category/product the property belongs to

subcategory.title: The subcategory the property belongs to

googleUserId.title: The ID of the Google User who connected the account

isBroken.title: A flag to show whether or not the property is working properly

campaigns.title: List of campaigns under the connected property

updated.title: The last time a view was updated

isBroken.title: A flag to show whether or not the view is working properly

campaigns.title: List of campaigns under the connected view

name.title: Label of the data point.  Field is called 'name' for ngx-chart compatibility, but in our case will be a Date
name for one set of data.  Used in the legend of the ngx-chart

cursor.description: Cursor allows paging of results, the next_cursor returned by the last response is expected.

v2LookupPropertiesRequest.title: LookupPropertiesRequest is the request of getting all connected properties for a given business

properties.title: List of propertys that's connected with the business

nextCursor.description: A string indicating the starting position of the next set of results. The client should pass this in the next request.

hasMore.description: A bool indicating if there are more results to be paged through.

partnerId.title: The Partner ID of the business to look up views

businessId.title: The Business ID of the business to look up views

category.title: The category of the views look up

cursor.description: Cursor allows paging of results, the next_cursor returned by the last response is expected.

v2LookupViewsRequest.title: LookupViewsRequest is the request of getting all connected views for a given business

views.title: List of views that's connected with the business

nextCursor.description: A string indicating the starting position of the next set of results. The client should pass this in the next request.

hasMore.description: A bool indicating if there are more results to be paged through.

v2LookupViewsResponse.title: LookupViewsResponse is the response of getting all connected views for a given business
